Body:
Description: I have 1 domain account that is used in 2 different connection profiles that keeps locking itself out (not the same Windows account used elsewhere in NEA for SQL and Tasks).  I have validated the password and manually reset it within the Connection Profiles.  Previously, there was an additional domain having this issue, but that was a copy/paste issue and has been resolved.

I have separated the schedules for my jobs to try to help troubleshoot this issue.  Each job runs on a different night (currently setup to stop after 8 hours).

Most recently, the account (ondemandsvcAuditor) locked this morning at 9:35am.  All my jobs run at 1:30 or 2am overnight.

The GROUP_Windows ran last night at 2am. It uses ALL DOMAIN CONTROLLERS for its host list.  Again, this is only impacting 1 of 7 domains I have.  I'm not sure where to look to investigate this further.  It may be related to issues I'm seeing in ticket 431038.  I have a call scheduled on Monday for that ticket.

What We've Learned Updated: Service account is getting locked out and customer thought it was due to jobs in NEA.
NEA jobs run between 1am and 3am and take less than 1 hour to complete. Lockout occured at 9:30am so the times don't line up.

Customer setup NTP to audit logins and authentications to try and track what may be triggering the account lockout.
Next Steps Updated: Awaiting lockout to occur again with NTP auditing to track the login events.
@Ian Ranstrom​ Do they use NAM? If there was a password change recently, I'd check the agent settings to make sure it's not used in there anywhere
Invitation updated. Attendees: No attendees listed
Invitation updated. Attendees: Ian Ranstrom, Angie Sawyer
Next Steps Updated: Attempting to reproduce internally.

What We've Learned Updated: Service account is getting locked out and customer thought it was due to jobs in NEA.
NEA jobs run between 1am and 3am and take less than 1 hour to complete. Lockout occured at 9:30am so the times don't line up.

Customer setup NTP to audit logins and authentications to try and track what may be triggering the account lockout.

--------
01/31/2025
--------
NEA users are sometimes getting locked out and the issue seems to be related to the ADI job running. We tested the account and noticed that the logs are not passing the domain along with the user name.
Next Steps Updated: Awaiting event logs from customer.
